reviewText: This is a great set that includes some of the best cheesy scifi from the 50's ever, several of which I haven't seen in other sets. I especially enjoyed Devil Girl From Mars, Cat Women on the Moon, and Invaders From Mars, but these are all famous or infamous flicks, the selection is spot on every movie is great, the prints are fairly decent, though not remastered, very nice set, great price.

reviewText: The Crawling Eye, The Screaming Skull, wonderful horror and science fiction craziness. Can't get enough of them and well worth the price!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I just bought this 2-DVD set at Kmart for only $5.00. It's a great bargain, considering it contains 12 low-budget horror movies from the 1950s, most of which made an appearance on the old "Mystery Science Theatre 3000" TV show, screened as bad movies for some laughs.The films in this set with the best production values are probably "The Crawling Eye" and "Invaders From Mars".  "The Killer Shrews", "The Screaming Skull", "The Wasp Woman" and Ed Wood's "Bride of the Monster" really aren't bad stories and can be fun to watch, although they all have deficiencies with special effects, some with poor acting. I'm surprised modern Hollywood hasn't considered remaking a few of them with a higher budget.The prints used for the DVD transfers of all the films in this collection are not the best available on the market either, but are generally acceptable, and overall it's a nice package at a rock-bottom price. There are a couple films included that are virtually unwatchable, but most anyone who enjoys old B movie horror/sci-fi films will find at least one or two films here to enjoy.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is a great deal for the price, 12 films from the 50's & 60's, with more than a few hard to find titles. These films are all in the Public Domain. I love "B" movies & this set really delivers. I already own about half of the titles on this disc on VHS & other DVD's...but, I was curious about The Crawling Eye, Invaders from Mars, and a few of the other goodies in this 2 DVD set. The overall quality is generally good. There are obvious signs of wear, jitter, and scratches, and a couple of the titles have a somewhat soft image. 12 movies, WOW!!! I am happily surprised with the quality for the most part. The majority of the movies in the set have a crisp image, I'm watching on a 53" rear projection TV. This set only cost me about 7 bucks, it gets 5 stars for Bang for the Buck!!! You could easily spend a lot more money looking for these titles on other labels & the quality probably wouldn't be much better. If you are a fan of the genre, get this...you won't be disappointed.
summary: An Awesome Collection Of B Flicks!

reviewText: This is a better than average cheapie movie pack.  These are old black and white flicks which have NOT been remastered.  Some prints are a bit grainy, some soundtracks need a boost, but overall I am very happy with this set.  These movies are tons of fun.
